dct_title_s:
L' Africa divisa nelle sue Parti secondo le pi√π moderne, relationi colle
          scoperte dell' origine e corso del Nilo
dct_description_sm:
First issued in Coronelli's atlas, Atlante Veneto. Double-sheet map includes a cartouche
        surrounded by various animals such as, an ostrich, crocodile, leopard, lion, camel, and an
        elephant. On the mainland a large piece of drapery with information about the Nile is
        encircled by two angels and Father Nile. Dedicated to Eccelenza del signor Gran Contestabile
        Colonna; Prime meridian through Ferro Island.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Dr. Oscar I. Norwich collection of maps of Africa and its islands, 1486 - ca. 1865 courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
